column2: We're in the biggest construction boom New Zealand has ever seen.
column5: According to this year’s National Construction Pipeline Report the value of all recorded building and construction was $34 billion in 2016. Data available from the Ministry of Business, Innovation & Employment (MBIE) stretches back to 1988 and shows this to be the highest level of total construction expenditure over that 30-year period (including adjusting for inflation). MBIE forecasts that the value of national building and construction will increase to $42 billion in 2020.
column10: Fact or Fiction: Do the leaders know?

column2: There's a separate immigration category for Labour's KiwiBuild programme
column5: Labour does have a policy under the immigration section on their website to introduce a KiwiBuild Visa. This visa is “for residential construction firms who train a local when they hire a worker from overseas".
column10: Fact or Fiction: Do the leaders know?
